Posted By: mdakw576 (5/22/2010 4:47:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Shadow1798 His abilities are very white. Take a look at [Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeance). That is an old card, that mechanic belonged to white long before black. If his + ability just made creatures attack without provoking them to himself (a selfless move, very frequently observed in white), then I would agree it's a red ability. If Gideon Jura were an inanimate object who became a soldier, then I would agree his last ability is an artifact ability. Clearly this isn't the case; he's stepping down from his pedestal as a mighty planeswalker and submitting himself personally to the battlefield (which, if you knew anything about Gideon Jura in the story, this is very characteristic of him).
posts.html:
@Shadow1798 His abilities are very white. Take a look at Vengeance. That is an old card, that mechanic belonged to white long before black. If his + ability just made creatures attack without provoking them to himself (a selfless move, very frequently observed in white), then I would agree it's a red ability. If Gideon Jura were an inanimate object who became a soldier, then I would agree his last ability is an artifact ability. Clearly this isn't the case; he's stepping down from his pedestal as a mighty planeswalker and submitting himself personally to the battlefield (which, if you knew anything about Gideon Jura in the story, this is very characteristic of him).

Posted By: Keiya (5/23/2011 12:56:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Both this and Sarkhan the Mad refer to themselves as "himself" where other cards say "itself". I guess WotC really want planeswalkers to stand out, with those special frames and parts of the picture overlapping it.  
  
Anyway, nice card. His plus can either be a Fog, or open up for an alpha strike, or just set up for his minus. And the minus... well, the guy's removal! His "ultimate" is weird, but both powerful and fun. I want to see what a "guyed" Gideon looks like in Magic Online.
posts.html:
Both this and Sarkhan the Mad refer to themselves as "himself" where other cards say "itself". I guess WotC really want planeswalkers to stand out, with those special frames and parts of the picture overlapping it.

Anyway, nice card. His plus can either be a Fog, or open up for an alpha strike, or just set up for his minus. And the minus... well, the guy's removal! His "ultimate" is weird, but both powerful and fun. I want to see what a "guyed" Gideon looks like in Magic Online.

@Florg: They made it so planeswalker abilities still have the "sorcery/once per turn" restriction even when copied just to avoid shenanigans like that.

posts.post_content:
It might seem weird from a flavor perspective why he'd be a 6/6 (since most humans tend to be 1/1s or 2/2s, maybe 3/3 at best). But it makes sense if you think about what it reflects about him - he's just that epic of a fighter that he can go toe to toe with massive Titans, Demons, Beasts, etc and actually win!
  
   
Also, @mdakw576 - BEST. COMMENT. EVER.

Posted By: Pie_Harbinger (10/5/2011 3:38:10 PM)

posts.post_content:
one of my favorite planeswalkers, which makes me all the angrier i don't have a place for him.  
  
i love the flavor behind his abilities, and his character.  
he commands from the front, showing he isn't afraid to be attacked, and easily reaches out to destroy any exposed creature, and when he feels like having fun, he joins his forces.  
  
so awesome, and combo full.  
5/5 for being gideon
